Deficiency Narrative: A staff member working at the operation had not had a background check completed.
Correction Narrative:
The Administrator provided a CAP stating all transactions done during their absence will be reviewed immediately upon their return. Ayanti will conduct monthly audit and review of all files to determine compliance, instead of doing so quarterly. Lastly, all onboarding requirements including background checks have been uploaded into ECP (Ayanti electronic system). The system will automatically generate notifications and alerts for missing documents. Candidates will not be activated until all requirements are met. 

In addition, the worker had been on suspension without pay due to non-compliance with training requirements even before the issue was brought to their attention. The worker was facing termination; and as of 6/7/2025, was terminated.

Deficiency Narrative: Interviews completed confirmed that overnight caregiver fell asleep while on shift.
Correction Narrative: Ayanti submitted a plan to maintain 24 hour awake supervision. Documents uploaded to document library.

Deficiency Narrative: Mutiple children have missed medication doses and there was no medical error documentation.
Correction Narrative:
Mutiple children have missed medication doses and there was no medical error documentation.

Corrected: Staff responsible for improper documentation has been terminated and all documentation following investigation has been correctly input according to operations training standard. Documentation submitted in document library.

Deficiency Narrative: Three children in care are not receiving their medication as prescribed due to medication running out.
Correction Narrative:
Three children in care are not receiving their medication as prescribed due to medication running out. 

Corrected: Medicaid prohibits early refills. Solution is to have the operation billed for necessary refills until medicaid reimburses. Documentation submitted in document library.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that a shower rod was rusted, and a toilet handle was missing in a bathroom accessible to children.
Correction Narrative: The rusted shower rod was changed. In addition, to the broken handle in the hallway bathroom was also replaced. Staff are now required to conduct a thorough walk through each shift, that includes bathroom, closet, etc., to identify issues with items that are not working properly, in order to report them in a timely manner.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation recreational activity calendar does not have indoor and outdoor recreational activities daily, some days only have indoor activities. In addition, the recreation should be planned according to the children's needs, interests and abilities.
Correction Narrative: The Recreation plan was updated to reflect indoor/outdoor activities for each day. In addition, a disclaimer was added to address recreational needs for children with special circumstances. The plan will be modified as needed.

Deficiency Narrative: The thermometer observed in the refrigerator indicated the temperature was at 49 degrees Fahrenheit.
Correction Narrative: New thermometers were placed in each refrigerator and freezer. Staff has been re-education to revert back to the facility policy on checking thermometers.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple employees were inactivated more than 7 days after being terminated.
Correction Narrative: After further review of this element, it was determined that the validation for the employee in question was done in a timely manner, however, there was an error on the termination date noted on file. The employee background check first cleared on a provisional basis, then conditional. Her actual  start date was indeed in May 2023, however, it was mistakenly recorded that the employeeÂ’s termination date was May 2023 (start date), instead of November 2023 which was her actual termination date. Close attention will be paid when updating information in the internal records to avoid errors like these from happening again.

Deficiency Narrative: The emergency evacuation plans posted upstairs did not have a designated location indicated as to where the caregivers and children meet. The diagram also does not indicate where one is standing to follow the emergency evacuation plan.
Correction Narrative: meeting point was indicated on revised evacuation plan diagram. each room on each floor reflect the new diagram.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation menu is not maintained daily there is a generic "summer menu" and also does not include any alternatives.
Correction Narrative: An adjustment was made to the menu to reflect the food being served each dday, on a monthly basis. Staff has been educated on the new process. In addition, menu was place on the refrigerator for staff to check the daily meals.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found in a child's file that the caseworker did not consent the use of a video camera .
Correction Narrative: Revised Admission assessment was emailed to inspector on 12/17/2022 at 12:10 am. The revision address 748.3353: Monitoring devices (see the revision in the document library of Ayanti RTC.

Deficiency Narrative: During the 3rd initial monitoring inspection 6 children in care medication records were reviewed. it was discovered that 3 of the children in care cumulative records were not updated correctly. 3 out of 6 Medication logs reviewed had a different number of pills listed from the prescription package.
Correction Narrative:
Ayanti GRO administrator provided  the inspector the medication test used to obtain feedback from the medication administration training conducted at Ayanti to cure the deficiency cited on 2/1. I have also attached the list of employees and the score obtained.

Also, I am in the process of purchasing a secure hippa complaint electronic platform where caregivers will be able to document, and medication count will be updated as the information is  imputed in the system. This will provide several more layers of safety, decrease potential for medication errors, and improve record keeping for each child entire record.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was found that since the operation opened in April (9 mths), they have never validated their employee list.
Correction Narrative: On 12/13/2022 the facility validated the background list. Please see the people list with the date of 12/13/2022 and an updated personnel master listed on 12/19/2022. The updated master list is in the CCR digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was found that 4 employees who no longer worked at the operation were still active in the People's List after 7 days.
Correction Narrative: On 12/17/2022 and 12/19/2022 Ms. Fisher provided the inspector by email with an updated Personal Master list with information pertaining to the 4 employer that are no longer employed by Ayanti. a copy is located in CCR digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: During inspection, it was found that 1 of 4 staff records reviewed did not have a First Aid certificate.
Correction Narrative: Follow up information was emailed to inspector on 12/17/2022 at 12:10 am. the emailed stated the following:  An employee is missing the first aid certification- the employee has been provided with 14 calendar days as of 12/13/22 (12/27/22) to complete the first aid training. Failure to provide a copy of the said document within the allotted time will result in termination of employment. In the meanwhile, the employee will not be able to provide care to the children independently. This employee will work with another competent employee at all times until the certification is obtained. The letter will be placed in the CCL Storage under the facility's name.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, 1 of 5 reviewed records was found to not have information of neonatal history.
Correction Narrative:
On 12/17/2022 Ms. Fisher emailed the inspector at 12:10 am a revised Treatment Center
Admission Assessment for the child in care Neonatal History. (A copy of the revision will be placed in the CCR digital storage under the agency's name and inspection number that occurred on 12/09/2022.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was noticed in 1 of 5 reviewed records that there was no previous school history.
Correction Narrative: Revised Admission assessment was emailed to inspector on 12/17/2022 at 12:10 am. The revision address in the child school history: (see the revision in the CCR digital storage section of Ayanti Monitoring inspection follow up section.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was found that the admission assessment did not mention the child s understanding of placement in 1 of 5 records.
Correction Narrative:
Revised Admission assessment was emailed to inspector on 12/17/2022 at 12:10 am.  
State the child's understanding of the placement: I have included this information in the document reviewed by the rep. Please find it in blue. I will request a review of this item because the information is there available in the admission package, just not in the specific section the rep reviewed. It was also signed by the child. (See revised copy in the CCR digital storage under Ayanti's Monitoring inspection follow-up section.

Deficiency Narrative: At the time of review, admission polices did not state the type of behaviors the operation accepts.
Correction Narrative:
Operation owner emailed corrected admission polices that now include behaviors accepted at the facility. 

New policy document added to SharePoint.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection two hanging poles in the closets upstairs were lose and easily removeable.
